item.title: -------------dragon clawz------------------
item.dc:creator: @wyski wyski
item.description:
@wyski wrote:

ok well most client have class8.java for their weapons, now i already have the models for the claws, but! my client uses itemdef.java for the ints. so anyone here have the d claws for itemdef.java becuz i only have the ones for class8.java and obv that wont work so if you can give me the ints. for d claws to put into itemdef.java thad be great. THNX

Claws for class8.java

if(i == 8002) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); class8.anInt200 = 13699; class8.anInt181 = 630; class8.anInt190 = 268; class8.anInt198 = 1340; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -7; class8.anInt194 = -13; class8.anInt165 = 13698; class8.anInt200 = 13698; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; }

And these are the codes on what a regular one is in itemdef.java

else if (i == 7993) { itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.actions[2] = "Dismantle"; itemDef.modifiedModelColors = new int[1]; itemDef.originalModelColors = new int [1]; itemDef.modelZoom = 1957;//Zoom itemDef.modelRotation1 = 498;//Rot1 itemDef.modelRotation2 = 484;//Rot2 itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1;//Offset1 itemDef.modelOffset2 = -1;//Offset2 itemDef.name = "Bandos godsword"; itemDef.description = "A brutally heavy sword.".getBytes(); itemDef.modelID = 28154;//Inv Look itemDef.guyModelID = 27726;//Equiped Guy Look itemDef.girlModelID = 27726;//Equiped Girl Look itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[1] = null; itemDef.value = 1041667; }
